name: Uptime Kuma - Setup, Monitor Creation, and Status Monitoring Flow
description: Verify initial setup, user creation, monitor configuration, dashboard viewing, and notification settings
steps: Navigate to http://localhost:3001
Verify the Uptime Kuma page loads and redirects to '/setup-database'
In the username input field, enter 'admin'
In the password input field, enter 'admin123456'
In the repeat password input field, enter 'admin123456'
Click the 'Create' button to set up the admin account
Verify successful account creation and redirect to the dashboard with URL '/dashboard'
Verify the 'Add New Monitor' button is displayed
Click the 'Add New Monitor' button
In the 'Monitor Type' dropdown, select 'HTTP(s)'
In the 'Friendly Name' input field, enter 'Google Homepage'
In the 'URL' input field, enter 'https://www.google.com'
Click the 'Save' button to create the monitor
Verify the monitor 'Google Homepage' appears in the monitor list with status 'Up'
Verify the response time is displayed for the monitor
Click on the monitor 'Google Homepage' to view details
Verify the monitor detail page loads showing uptime percentage and response time chart
Click the 'Edit' button to modify the monitor
Change the 'Heartbeat Interval' to 120 seconds
Click 'Save' to update the monitor configuration
Navigate to 'Settings' from the top right menu
Click on the 'Notifications' tab
Click 'Setup Notification' to add a notification channel
In the notification type dropdown, select 'Webhook'
In the 'Friendly Name' field, enter 'Test Webhook' and in 'URL' field enter 'https://webhook.site/test'
Click 'Save' to add the notification channel
Verify the notification 'Test Webhook' appears in the notifications list
Click 'Dashboard' to return to the main dashboard
Verify all monitors are displayed with their current status
Click the user profile icon and select 'Logout'
Verify redirect to the login page
Enter username 'admin' and password 'admin123456' in the login form
Click 'Login' button and verify successful login to the dashboard
